channel.title: Bridges updates
channel.description:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Bridges#Step_2:_edit_.2Fetc.2Ftor.2Ftorrc_.28for_all_Whonix_platforms.29
Is there apparmor profile for obfs4proxy?
Can we add ClientTransportPlugin lines by default? So users don't have to
There is no need for obfsproxy anymore as obfs4proxy supports previous versions and Tor Browser uses only obfs4proxy
> ClientTransportPlugin obfs2,obfs3,obfs4 exec /usr/bin/obfs4proxy > ClientTransportPlugin fte exec /usr/bin/fteproxy --managed

item.title: Bridges updates
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
anonymous1:

Can we add ClientTransportPlugin lines by default? So users don’t have to

That’s up to Tor Project / pluggable transport package maintainer. More info:
https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor/ticket/21453

(Which has to wait until https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor/ticket/1922 is implemented.)

anonymous1:

Is there apparmor profile for obfs4proxy?

I don’t think so.

Package obfsproxy owns /etc/apparmor.d/usr.bin.obfsproxy. Related:

  • https://github.com/Whonix/anon-gw-anonymizer-config/blob/master/etc/apparmor.d/local/system_tor.anondist
  • https://github.com/Whonix/anon-gw-anonymizer-config/blob/master/etc/apparmor.d/local/usr.bin.obfsproxy.anondist

Package obfs4proxy owns no file in /etc/apparmor.d/.

  • apt-file list obfsproxy
  • apt-file list obfs4proxy

Related:
Add obfs4proxy to the default tor apparmor profile

  • https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor/ticket/14014
  • https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/tor/+bug/1568435
  • http://tor.stackexchange.com/questions/11765/problem-with-obfs4proxy-and-apparmor-solved

Read full topic
